alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 17 at 10:11AM EST until January 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, up to two feet of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 10 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...Accomack County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 3 PM EST this afternoon. For the High Surf Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Some roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NASSAWADOX CREEK AT BAYFORD VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.0 FT, MODERATE 3.5 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.0 FT, MODERATE 1.5 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/10 AM 2.6 0.6 0.8 5 NONE 17/10 PM 1.4 -0.6 0.0 4-5 NONE 18/10 AM 1.5 -0.5 -0.3 2-4 NONE 18/10 PM 1.1 -0.9 -0.3 1-2 NONE 19/10 AM 1.3 -0.7 -0.5 2-3 NONE 19/11 PM 1.1 -0.9 -0.4 2 NONE CHINCOTEAGUE INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.2 FT, MAJOR 3.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/08 PM 1.9 -0.9 -0.1 3-4 NONE 18/08 AM 2.8 0.0 0.0 3 NONE 18/08 PM 2.0 -0.8 0.0 2 NONE 19/09 AM 3.0 0.2 0.2 2 NONE 19/09 PM 2.1 -0.7 0.0 1-2 NONE SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/12 PM 4.6 2.1 2.2 3-4 MINOR 18/12 AM 3.0 0.5 1.2 3 NONE 18/12 PM 2.7 0.2 0.3 2 NONE 19/01 AM 2.1 -0.4 0.2 1 NONE 19/01 PM 2.9 0.4 0.5 2 NONE 20/01 AM 2.7 0.2 0.8 2 NONE WACHAPREAGUE VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 6.5 FT, MODERATE 7.5 FT, MAJOR 8.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/08 PM 3.2 -1.3 -0.3 1 NONE 18/09 AM 3.8 -0.7 -0.6 1 NONE 18/09 PM 3.0 -1.5 -0.6 1 NONE 19/10 AM 3.8 -0.7 -0.5 1 NONE 19/10 PM 3.0 -1.5 -0.6 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
